thread.title: Japan PM wants to see resolution to abduction issue from talks with North Korea

title: Japan PM wants to see resolution to abduction issue from talks with North Korea
text: March 13, 2018 / 2:24 AM / Updated 28 minutes ago Japan PM wants to see resolution to abduction issue from   Reuters Staff 1 Min Read TOKYO (Reuters) - Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Tuesday that Japan wanted to see a resolution to the issue of past abductions of Japanese citizens from   and that North Korea must match its words with actions. FILE PHOTO: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe tells reporters at his office in Tokyo on March 12, 2018, that he deeply apologizes to the public over the Finance Ministry's alternations of documents over a state land sale. Mandatory credit Kyodo/via REUTERS Abe was meeting South Korean National Intelligence Service chief Suh Hoon to discuss upcoming  .   has agreed to meet   by the end of May.   also plans a summit to hold a summit with Kim by the end of April. Reporting by Tim Kelly; Editing by Chris Gallagher
